summary: "Tomorrow Never Dies" is a 1997 spy movie, the 18th in the James Bond series, with Pierce Brosnan as Bond. In this film, Bond stops a media mogul, Elliot Carver (Jonathan Pryce), from trying to start World War III. It was the first Bond film after producer Albert R. Broccoli's death. Though it made a lot of money ($333 million worldwide), it didn't open at No. 1 in the U.S. because it premiered the same day as "Titanic."
title: Tomorrow Never Dies
